chapter.name: MaxScore: Sidebar
chapter.p: On top of the right sidebar you can see four tab item:
Each of these corresponds to specific features that you can use when creating your score.

Under Tools you can customize the note durations or pauses, hide or modify note heads and other attributes, create beamings and note groups, add markings, as well as select key signatures, set the tempo, measure width, and pick various barlines. On this pane, you can also set pitch (see also Pitch Utility fot more choices), amplitude, duration, and text attributes. For advanced users, the "Inspect" button provides an option to inspect various elements or the entire score in JSON format.

In the Pitch Utility you can perform a wide range of pitch-selection operations, apply transpositions in cent precision and take advantage of the possibility of entering microtonal scales with the Virtual Keyboards included in the Entry Tool menu on the bottom.
In the Scorepions provide a plugin structure for MaxScore which allow you to use existing Scorepions to perform various operations and to ultimately add your own patches to the repertoire.

The Picster pane provides a GUI to the sophisticated graphics editor, designed to add various graphical elements or to create an entire graphical score with the ability to attach Expressions to every graphical element. Expressions contain messages which can be used to control the Max environment.

p.i: You will find more information in the following chapters.
